query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Così di ponte in ponte, altro parlando 2 che la mia comedìa cantar non cura, 3 venimmo; e tenavamo ’l colmo, quando
4 restammo per veder l’altra fessura 5 di Malebolge e li altri pianti vani; 6 e vidila mirabilmente oscura.
query.result:
1 Thus from bridge to bridge, speaking other things 2 than to care for singing my comedy, 3 we came; and we held the summit, when
4 we remained to see the other opening 5 of Malebolge and the other empty cries; 6 and saw it marvelously dark.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Quale ne l’arzanà de’ Viniziani 8 bolle l’inverno la tenace pece 9 a rimpalmare i legni lor non sani,
10 ché navicar non ponno—in quella vece 11 chi fa suo legno novo e chi ristoppa 12 le coste a quel che più vïaggi fece;
13 chi ribatte da proda e chi da poppa; 14 altri fa remi e altri volge sarte; 15 chi terzeruolo e artimon rintoppa—:
16 tal, non per foco ma per divin’ arte, 17 bollia là giuso una pegola spessa, 18 che ’nviscava la ripa d’ogne parte.
query.result:
7 As in the arsenal of the Venetians 8 boils in winter the tenacious pitch 9 to caulk their not-sound timbers,
10 because they cannot sail—in that place 11 he who makes his wood new and he who patches 12 the sides to him who made the most voyages;
13 one re-caulks from prow and one from stern; 14 another makes oars and another turns sails; 15 one repairs the topgallant and the mizzenmast—:
16 thus, not by fire but by divine art, 17 boiled there below a thick pitch, 18 that glued the bank on every side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 I’ vedea lei, ma non vedëa in essa 20 mai che le bolle che ’l bollor levava, 21 e gonfiar tutta, e riseder compressa.
query.result: 19 I saw it, but I did not see within it 20 ever that the bubbles that the boiling raised, 21 and inflate it all, and settle compressed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Mentr’ io là giù fisamente mirava, 23 lo duca mio, dicendo «Guarda, guarda!», 24 mi trasse a sé del loco dov’ io stava.
query.result: 22 While I there below fixedly gazed, 23 my leader, saying “Look, look!”, 24 drew me to himself from the place where I was.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Allor mi volsi come l’uom cui tarda 26 di veder quel che li convien fuggire 27 e cui paura sùbita sgagliarda,
28 che, per veder, non indugia ’l partire: 29 e vidi dietro a noi un diavol nero 30 correndo su per lo scoglio venire.
query.result:
25 Then I turned as the man to whom it is slow 26 to see what he needs to flee 27 and to whom sudden fear makes agile,
28 that, to see, does not delay the departing: 29 and I saw behind us a black devil 30 running up over the rock to come.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Ahi quant’ elli era ne l’aspetto fero! 32 e quanto mi parea ne l’atto acerbo, 33 con l’ali aperte e sovra i piè leggero!
34 L’omero suo, ch’era aguto e superbo, 35 carcava un peccator con ambo l’anche, 36 e quei tenea de’ piè ghermito ’l nerbo.
query.result:
31 Ah, how fierce he was in appearance! 32 and how rough he seemed in the act, 33 with the wings open and light over the feet!
34 His shoulder, which was sharp and proud, 35 was clutching a sinner with both flanks, 36 and that one held the sinews of the feet gripped tight.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Del nostro ponte disse: «O Malebranche, 38 ecco un de li anzïan di Santa Zita! 39 Mettetel sotto, ch’i’ torno per anche
40 a quella terra, che n’è ben fornita: 41 ogn’ uom v’è barattier, fuor che Bonturo; 42 del no, per li denar, vi si fa ita».
query.result:
37 Of our bridge he said: “O Malebranche, 38 here is one of the old men of Saint Zita! 39 Put him below, because I return by flanks
40 to that land, which is well supplied with it: 41 every man there is a bargainer, except Bonturo; 42 for the no, for the money, it is done to you.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Là giù ’l buttò, e per lo scoglio duro 44 si volse; e mai non fu mastino sciolto 45 con tanta fretta a seguitar lo furo.
query.result: 43 There below he threw him, and over the hard rock 44 he turned; and never was a mastiff loosed 45 with such haste to follow the fury.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Quel s’attuffò, e tornò sù convolto; 47 ma i demon che del ponte avean coperchio, 48 gridar: «Qui non ha loco il Santo Volto!
49 qui si nuota altrimenti che nel Serchio! 50 Però, se tu non vuo’ di nostri graffi, 51 non far sopra la pegola soverchio».
query.result:
46 He plunged, and returned up coiled; 47 but the demons who had the covering of the bridge 48 cried: “Here the Holy Face has no place!
49 here one swims differently than in the Serchio! 50 Therefore, if you do not want our scratches, 51 do not make too much weight on the pitch.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Poi l’addentar con più di cento raffi, 53 disser: «Coverto convien che qui balli, 54 sì che, se puoi, nascosamente accaffi».
query.result: 52 Then they bit him with more than a hundred scratches, 53 said: “Covered you must dance here, 54 so that, if you can, you secretly gather.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Non altrimenti i cuoci a’ lor vassalli 56 fanno attuffare in mezzo la caldaia 57 la carne con li uncin, perché non galli.
query.result: 55 Not otherwise do cooks to their vassals 56 make the meat plunge into the middle of the cauldron 57 with hooks, so that it does not crow.

58 The good master, “So that it does not appear 59 that you are here,” he said to me, “down you crouch 60 after a splinter, that some shield may be to you;
61 and for no offense that is done to me, 62 do not fear you, for I have the things counted, 63 because another time I was at such a bargain.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Poscia passò di là dal co del ponte; 65 e com’ el giunse in su la ripa sesta, 66 mestier li fu d’aver sicura fronte.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Con quel furore e con quella tempesta 68 ch’escono i cani a dosso al poverello 69 che di sùbito chiede ove s’arresta,
70 usciron quei di sotto al ponticello, 71 e volser contra lui tutt’ i runcigli; 72 ma el gridò: «Nessun di voi sia fello!
73 Innanzi che l’uncin vostro mi pigli, 74 traggasi avante l’un di voi che m’oda, 75 e poi d’arruncigliarmi si consigli».
query.result:
67 With that fury and with that tempest 68 that dogs come out against the poor man 69 who suddenly asks where he stops,
70 those from below the small bridge came out, 71 and turned against him all their claws; 72 but he cried out: “None of you be a companion!
73 Before your hook takes me, 74 let one of you come forward who hears me, 75 and then consider throwing me down.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Tutti gridaron: «Vada Malacoda!»; 77 per ch’un si mosse—e li altri stetter fermi— 78 e venne a lui dicendo: «Che li approda?».

Please translate each line literally into English.
79 «Credi tu, Malacoda, qui vedermi 80 esser venuto», disse ’l mio maestro, 81 «sicuro già da tutti vostri schermi,
82 sanza voler divino e fato destro? 83 Lascian’ andar, ché nel cielo è voluto 84 ch’i’ mostri altrui questo cammin silvestro».
query.result:
79 “Do you believe, Malacoda, here to see me 80 having come,” said my master, 81 already safe from all your shields,
82 without wanting divine and right fate? 83 Let him go, because in heaven it is willed 84 that I show another this wild path.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Allor li fu l’orgoglio sì caduto, 86 ch’e’ si lasciò cascar l’uncino a’ piedi, 87 e disse a li altri: «Omai non sia feruto».
query.result: 85 Then to him was the pride so fallen, 86 that he let the hook fall to the feet, 87 and said to the others: “Now let him not be harmed.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E ’l duca mio a me: «O tu che siedi 89 tra li scheggion del ponte quatto quatto, 90 sicuramente omai a me ti riedi».
query.result: 88 And my leader to me: “O you who sit 89 among the splinters of the quiet bridge, 90 surely now return to me.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 I’ m’accostai con tutta la persona 98 lungo ’l mio duca, e non torceva li occhi 99 da la sembianza lor ch’era non buona.
query.result: 97 I drew near with all my person 98 along my leader, and did not turn his eyes 99 from their appearance which was not good.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Ei chinavan li raffi e «Vuo’ che ’l tocchi», 101 diceva l’un con l’altro, «in sul groppone?». 102 E rispondien: «Sì, fa che gliel’ accocchi».
query.result: 100 They were filling the claws and “Do you want me to touch him,” 101 said one to the other, “on the hunchback?” 102 And they responded: “Yes, make him cling to it.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Ma quel demonio che tenea sermone 104 col duca mio, si volse tutto presto 105 e disse: «Posa, posa, Scarmiglione!».
query.result: 103 But that demon who held discourse 104 with my leader, turned completely quickly 105 and said: “Lay down, lay down, Scarmiglione!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Poi disse a noi: «Più oltre andar per questo 107 iscoglio non si può, però che giace 108 tutto spezzato al fondo l’arco sesto.
query.result: 106 Then he said to us: “Further to go through this 107 rock is not possible, because it lies 108 all broken at the bottom the sixth arch.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 E se l’andare avante pur vi piace, 110 andatevene su per questa grotta; 111 presso è un altro scoglio che via face.

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Ier, più oltre cinqu’ ore che quest’ otta, 113 mille dugento con sessanta sei 114 anni compié che qui la via fu rotta.
query.result: 112 Yesterday, more than five hours after this eighth, 113 a thousand two hundred with sixty six 114 years completed that here the way was broken.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Io mando verso là di questi miei 116 a riguardar s’alcun se ne sciorina; 117 gite con lor, che non saranno rei».

Please translate each line literally into English.
118 «Tra’ti avante, Alichino, e Calcabrina», 119 cominciò elli a dire, «e tu, Cagnazzo; 120 e Barbariccia guidi la decina.

Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Libicocco vegn’ oltre e Draghignazzo, 122 Cirïatto sannuto e Graffiacane 123 e Farfarello e Rubicante pazzo.
query.result: 121 Libicocco comes beyond and Draghignazzo, 122 Cirïatto known and Graffiacane 123 and Farfarello and Rubicante mad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Cercate ’ntorno le boglienti pane; 125 costor sian salvi infino a l’altro scheggio 126 che tutto intero va sovra le tane».

Please translate each line literally into English.
127 «Omè, maestro, che è quel ch’i’ veggio?», 128 diss’ io, «deh, sanza scorta andianci soli, 129 se tu sa’ ir; ch’i’ per me non la cheggio.
query.result: 127 “Oh, master, what is that I see?” 128 I said, “ah, without escort let them go alone, 129 if you know how to go; I do not ask it for myself.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Se tu se’ sì accorto come suoli, 131 non vedi tu ch’e’ digrignan li denti 132 e con le ciglia ne minaccian duoli?».
query.result: 130 If you are as astute as you are used to be, 131 do you not see that they gnash their teeth 132 and with their eyelashes threaten pains?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Ed elli a me: «Non vo’ che tu paventi; 134 lasciali digrignar pur a lor senno, 135 ch’e’ fanno ciò per li lessi dolenti».
